page.title: 12Education in Chorley (2)
page.content: In Chorley as in many parts of Lancashire there is a mixture of Church and State schools. There are nine Church primary schools, and these are made up of five Church of England schools and four Roman Catholic schools. The majority of the managers in these schools are appointed by the respective denominations. The majority of the managers of the state schools are really political appointees. The church schools are;'All Saints C.E. St.Laurence's C.E. Sacred Heart R.C. St.George's C.E. St.Jame's C.E. St.Joseph's R.C. St.Mary's R.C. St.Gregory's R.C. and St.Peter's C.E. Their total child population is approximatly 1600 children.
